intro: Marlimorimia bahiana, commonly known as the Bahian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
